column1: The Great West Road was the name of the portion of the Great Road east of the Fords of Isen and was known as a horse-road.
After two miles it bent sharply to the south-east to meet the Deeping-road and again bent to the east and Edoras.; as horse-road It passed across Calenardhon/Rohan parallel to the White Mountains
